Package org.bloomreach.forge.brut.resources.util

Class RequestBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.bloomreach.forge.brut.resources.util.RequestBuilder
public class RequestBuilder extends Object
Fluent builder for setting up and executing HST requests in tests. Reduces request setup boilerplate from 5+ lines to a single fluent chain.

Example usage: 

 brxm.request()
     .get("/site/api/hello/user")
     .withAccept(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
     .assertBody("Hello, World! user");

    Class

    RequestBuilder.RequestExecutor
    Internal interface for executing requests - supports both JAX-RS and PageModel tests.

    Internal interface for retrieving response status code.

    • get

      public RequestBuilder get(String uri)
      Sets up a GET request to the specified URI.
      Parameters:
      uri - request URI (e.g., "/site/api/hello/user")
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withAccept

      public RequestBuilder withAccept(String mediaType)
      Sets the Accept header (default: application/json for JAX-RS).
      Parameters:
      mediaType - media type (use MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON, etc.)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

      Parameters:

      value - header value
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withBody

      public RequestBuilder withBody(String body)
      Sets the request body as a string. Does NOT set Content-Type header automatically. Use withJsonBody(String) for JSON payloads which sets the Content-Type.
      Parameters:
      body - request body content
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withJsonBody

      public RequestBuilder withJsonBody(String json)
      Sets the request body as JSON string and sets Content-Type to application/json.

      Example usage: 

       brxm.request()
     .post("/site/api/users")
     .withJsonBody("{\"name\": \"John\"}")
     .execute();
      Parameters:
      json - JSON string body
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withJsonBody

      public RequestBuilder withJsonBody(Object object) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Serializes the object to JSON and sets it as the request body. Also sets Content-Type to application/json.

      Example usage: 

       User user = new User("John", 30);
 brxm.request()
     .post("/site/api/users")
     .withJsonBody(user)
     .executeAs(User.class);
      Parameters:
      object - object to serialize as JSON body
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if serialization fails

    • queryParam

      public RequestBuilder queryParam(String name, String value)
      Adds a query parameter. Multiple calls accumulate parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - parameter name
      value - parameter value
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • asUser

      public RequestBuilder asUser(String username, String... roles)
      Sets up the request as an authenticated user with specified roles. Sets both remoteUser and userPrincipal for maximum compatibility.
      Parameters:
      username - the authenticated username
      roles - roles assigned to the user
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withRole

      public RequestBuilder withRole(String... roles)
      Sets up roles for the request without specifying a username. Useful for testing role-based access without full user context.
      Parameters:
      roles - roles to assign
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • pageModelComponentRendering

      public RequestBuilder pageModelComponentRendering(String ref)
      Convenience method for PageModel API component-rendering requests. Sets _hn:type=component-rendering and _hn:ref={ref}.
      Parameters:
      ref - component reference (e.g., "r5_r1_r1")
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • execute

      public String execute()
      Executes the request and returns the response body.
      Returns:
      response body as string

    • executeAsPageModel

      public PageModelResponse executeAsPageModel() throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Executes the request and parses the response as a PageModelResponse. Convenience method for PageModel API requests.
      Returns:
      parsed PageModelResponse
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if JSON parsing fails

    • executeAs

      public <T> T executeAs(Class<T> responseType) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Executes the request and deserializes the JSON response to the specified type. Uses Jackson ObjectMapper with lenient settings (unknown properties ignored).

      Example usage: 

       User user = brxm.request()
     .get("/site/api/user/123")
     .executeAs(User.class);
      Type Parameters:
      T - the target type
      Parameters:
      responseType - the class to deserialize to
      Returns:
      deserialized response object
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if JSON parsing fails

    • executeWithStatus

      public Response<String> executeWithStatus()
      Executes the request and returns the response with status code. The response body is returned as a raw string.

      Example usage: 

       Response<String> response = brxm.request()
     .get("/site/api/health")
     .executeWithStatus();

 assertThat(response.status()).isEqualTo(200);
      Returns:
      Response containing status code and raw body

    • executeWithStatus

      public <T> Response<T> executeWithStatus(Class<T> responseType) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Executes the request and returns the response with status code and typed body. Uses Jackson ObjectMapper with lenient settings (unknown properties ignored).

      Example usage: 

       Response<User> response = brxm.request()
     .post("/site/api/users")
     .withJsonBody(newUser)
     .executeWithStatus(User.class);

 assertThat(response.status()).isEqualTo(201);
 assertThat(response.body().getName()).isEqualTo("John");
      Type Parameters:
      T - the target type
      Parameters:
      responseType - the class to deserialize to
      Returns:
      Response containing status code and deserialized body
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if JSON parsing fails

    • assertBody

      public RequestBuilder assertBody(String expected)
      Executes the request and asserts the response body equals expected value.
      Parameters:
      expected - expected response body
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining (allows further assertions)
